wikipedia_page.main: Peter Arnold Lienhardt (12 March 1928 – 17 March 1986) was a British social anthropologist.

response: He then won the Inlaks Foundation scholarship to complete a D. Phil. in social anthropology at St Edmund Hall, Oxford, under the supervision of British social anthropologist Peter Lienhardt. The thesis, undertaken in the Faculty of Anthropology and Geography, was entitled "Kinship in relation to economic and social organization in an Egyptian village community" and submitted in 1982.Srivastava, Neelam, "Amitav Ghosh's enthographic fictions: Intertextual links between In An Antique Land and his doctoral thesis", Journal of Commonwealth Literature, 2001, Vol.36(2), pp.45-64.

to Downing by his brother Peter Lienhardt, who also read English and became an anthropologist.Ahmed Al-Shahi "Peter Lienhardt, 1928-1986: biographical notes and bibliography" JASO 27/2, 1996, pp.107-112
*Peter Lienhardt in American Anthropologist, New Series 66:1 (1964), pp. 164–166.
